newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Patten's two dogs to depart HK for France Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Patten's two dogs to depart HK for France Thursday.

text.p: Hong Kong's "first dogs", Whisky and Soda, will depart for France on Thursday ahead of the Hong Kong handover which ends their master Chris Patten's job as 28th and last British governor.
The pair, whose antics often hit headlines and provided material for political cartoonists, received their innoculations on Wednesday ahead of their flight to the French city of Toulouse.
The pups, along with the Pattens, spent five years in the British colony, set for return to China at midnight June 30.
The Pattens, who have spearheaded a campaign against Britain's strict six-month quarantine laws, are sending their two Norfolk Terriers to France where the rules are laxer.
They hope the British rules will be changed before the Pattens' planned sojourn in Frnnce ends and they return to Britain, friends said.
Soda made international headlines in 1992 when she disappeared for four days prompting jokes of "dognapping" for the cookpot. Dog is a winter delicacy in south China.

Whisky spent seven days in dog custody for nipping a workman at the official residence, Government House and then almost died when he fell victim to Hong Kong's notorious "Bowen Road Dog poisoner" in March.
The Foreign Correspondents' Club voted the doggy duo "Unforgettable Faces of Hong Kong" and featured their portrait on the inner backcover of their 1997 handover magazine.
